children.value: This code creates a graphical user interface (GUI) application that displays and allows editing of a sample data table. Here’s a breakdown of the code:
. This means it creates a window with a frame border.
Several variables are declared to store data used throughout the program:
: Integers specifying the number of rows and columns in the data table.
: A 2D String array to hold the sample data.
object used as the data model for the JTable.
objects used for adding new records.
: An array of Strings containing the column names for the table.
: An array of Strings containing city names used in the program.
Several other variables are used to store UI layout properties and references to UI components.
method generates random sample data. It populates the
array with first names, last names, cities, salaries, and unique IDs.
method (generated by the GUI builder) initializes the Swing components used in the frame.
constructor performs most of the application logic:
Sets the frame size and location.
to set up the data model for the table.
to configure and display the JTable.
Calls other methods to add functionalities like:
A label to display data from a selected row (
A button to delete a selected row (
A search bar to filter data (
A checkbox to hide the ID column (
Input fields and a button to add new records (
This method configures the JTable’s behavior and appearance:
Sets the table’s columns to automatically resize.
Enables sorting by clicking column headers.
Sets the table selection mode to single selection.
Attaches listeners to the table for selection changes and cell edits.
Sets a custom renderer for the salary column to format the numbers.
Creates a scroll pane to hold the table and adds it to the frame.
: Creates the data model for the JTable and specifies that all cells are editable.
: Creates and configures a label to display data from the selected row.
: Creates and configures a button to delete the selected row. It ensures deletion by ID to avoid errors.
: Creates and configures a search bar to filter the table data based on user input.
: Filters the table data based on the text entered in the search bar.
: Creates and configures a checkbox to hide the ID column of the table.
: Creates and configures input fields and a button to allow adding new records to the table.
: Creates a dropdown menu in the city column to allow users to select pre-defined city names.
: Sets a custom renderer for the salary column to format the numbers.
: Prints the contents of the data model to the console for debugging purposes.
: Handles the action when the “Print” menu item is clicked. It attempts to print the JTable using the default printing functionality.
Overall, this code demonstrates how to create a data table with functionalities like sorting, filtering, editing, adding new records, and basic printing using Swing components in Java.
This code defines a custom table cell renderer class named
. It’s specifically designed to format table cell values as currency.
Here’s a breakdown of the code:
. This means it inherits all the functionalities of the default renderer and can override specific methods to customize the rendering behavior.
The constructor sets the horizontal alignment of the text in the cell to right-aligned (
). This is commonly used for displaying numeric values.
This is the most important method in a custom cell renderer. It’s called whenever a cell needs to be rendered in the table.
: The value of the object to be rendered in the cell.
: Whether the cell is currently selected.
: The row index of the cell.
: The column index of the cell.
The method performs the following steps:
Tries to format the value as currency:
to format it according to the current locale’s number formatting rules (e.g., commas for thousands separators).
, it attempts to parse it as an integer using
. Then, it prepends a dollar sign (“$”) and formats the integer value using
method. This is important because it retrieves the base renderer component and applies any customizations we made (like setting the alignment) on top of the default behavior.
If any exception occurs during formatting (
. This might indicate an issue with the data type or format, and the cell will likely be left blank.
This custom renderer ensures that any numeric values displayed in the table are formatted as currency, improving readability and user experience.
